result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kleaontae L Beasley

records.addlTxt:
10:46 AM Defendant Kleaontae L Beasley in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg appeared by phone for Kleaontae L Beasley.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Tishberg did not receive an offer.
State will forward offer.
Hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 10-25-2022 received and filed.

1:47 PM Defendant Kleaontae L Beasley in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Kleaontae L Beasley.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Atty Tishberg is going to pick up discovery today and requests an adjournment.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter dated 10-12-2022 received and filed.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS. Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:07 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Kleaontae L Beasley in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Kleaontae L Beasley. 

The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. 
Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

9:04 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Kleaontae L Beasley in court.  Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court for Kleaontae L Beasley. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
The Court puts the Defendant on notice that if it receives a WCS non-compliance letter, that the Court will forfeit bail and issue a warrant.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Request to adjourn Initial Appearance
  **Reviewed by Commissioner David Herring on 08-08-2022. "Noting there are no victim notification issues the court will grant unless objection from the prosecution."

Adjustment Number: 22A 030812,
Payable Number: 471607,
Receipt Number: 22R 033234,
Amount: $20.00
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
